intro: Genista ptilophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences, which attract pollinators like bees. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with thorny stems and narrow, leathery leaves.
